contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Kjeller |other_name = |native_name = |nickname = |settlement_type = Village |image_skyline = |image_caption = |pushpin_map = |pushpin_label_position = top |pushpin_mapsize = |pushpin_map_caption = Location in [[Sør-Trøndelag]] |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = NO |coordinates_type = type:city |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = [[Norway]] |subdivision_type1 = [[List of regions of Norway|Region]] |subdivision_name1 = [[Østlandet]] |subdivision_type2 = [[Counties of Norway|County]] |subdivision_name2 = [[Akershus]] |subdivision_type3 = [[Districts of Norway|District]] |subdivision_name3 = |subdivision_type4 = [[List of municipalities of Norway|Municipality]] |subdivision_name4 = |area_total_km2= |population_as_of= |population_note= |population_total= |population_density_km2= |timezone1 = [[Central European Time|CET]] |utc_offset1 = +01:00 |timezone1_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] |utc_offset1_DST = +02:00 |postal_code_type = Post Code |postal_code = |elevation_m = |elevation_footnotes = |latd = |latm = |lats = |latNS = N |longd= |longm= |longs= |longEW= E }} '''Kjeller''' is a village located near [[Lillestrøm]] in the municipality of [[Skedsmo]], [[Norway]]. It is located 25 kilometers north of [[Oslo]]. ==The name== The [[Norse language|Norse]] form of the name was probably ''Tjaldir''. This is then the [[plural]] of ''tjald'' n '[[tent]]'. The hills around the farm (''Kjellerhaugen'' and others) might have been compared in form with tents. ==Facilities== Kjeller contains: *[[Kjeller Airport]] *Norwegian Defence Logistic Organization (''FLO'') *The Norwegian Defence Research Establishment (''FFI'') *The [[Institute for Energy Technology]] (''IFE''), including one of Norway's two nuclear research reactors. *[[Norwegian Institute for Air Research]] *The Norwegian Standardisation Bureau *[[UNIK]] (University Graduate Center) *[[Oslo and Akershus University College of Applied Sciences]] *[[NORSAR]] (Norwegian Seismic Array) Historically, Kjeller has also been the location for a small [[aircraft]] factory. The [[Telenor]] Research Centre was located in Kjeller until 2001, when the majority of employees moved to [[Fornebu]] on 23 November. Akershus University College was opened in autumn 2003 at Telenor's previous location. Approximately 3700 students attend the university. ===Nuclear reactor=== The nuclear reactor at Kjeller, opened on November 28, 1951 was the first reactor outside the [[United States|US]], [[Soviet Union]], [[Canada]], [[Great Britain]] and [[France]]. It was a joint project by the Dutch and Norwegian governments. The Netherlands supplied the uranium and Norway the [[heavy water]]. The nuclear reactor is used in scientific research and is together with a nuclear reactor in [[Halden]] Norway's only two nuclear reactors. Neither of them is in commercial use. On 9 September 2006, the reactor suffered a "contained" leak which forced it to shut down for three weeks for repairs.<ref>[http://www.cnn.com/2006/WORLD/europe/09/09/norway.nuclear.ap/ www.cnn.com September 9, 2006]</ref> <ref>[http://web.archive.org/web/20070909190942/http://www.ife.no/ife_news/2006/hendelsen_2006-09-20-funnet_feil/view?set_language=en&cl=en www.ife.no September 20, 2006]</ref> <ref>[http://www.blather.net/north/archives/2007/09/can_someone_please_explain_the_kjeller_i.html www.blather.net September 2007]</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{coord|59|59|N|11|02|E|region:NO_type:city|display=title}} [[Category:Villages in Akershus]] [[Category:Skedsmo]] {{Akershus-geo-stub}}
